comment.author: 35672655@N00
comment._content:
that photo is approx 1888.
the clock faces where added in 1891.

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sydney's older buildings and structures. , and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this item (top of column 4) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13614555 , the removal of scaffolding at the GPO tower was completed in mid March 1886...in this pic we can see the beams left in the tower by the contractors for hoisting the bells. The clock faces appear to have been fitted between July 1891 (when the clock and bells arrived in Sydney) and the official 'starting' in September 1891. So we're looking at a date range of March 1886 - September 1891. Per this notice George Webster & Co appear to have been in Market St in April 1887 (column 5, towards the bottom) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13653762 ; per this notice they were at Barrack St by May 1888 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13685752 ; various digitised newspaper hits indicate they were still there in December 1891 ; GW & Co appear to have initially occupied No. 7 Barrack St but later moved to No. 9. Per a couple of digitised newspaper hits the move appears to have taken place some time between June - December 1889.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this SMH article, David Jones 'splendid new premises' at the corner of George and Barrack Streets was evidently nearing completion in March 1887 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article28355835 ...just going on this pic www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2376884726/ it's difficult to tell whether we see DJ's new premises here...the building appears to be the same...but the awning differs...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this article there was evidently a fire at 18 Barrack Street in July 1887 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13654726

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=168183 ; this fantastic SLNSW pic shows the GPO tower nearing completion, with the scaffolding still in place...per this SMH item nla.gov.au/nla.news-article28364355 the stonework on the GPO tower was completed in late September 1885...leaving only the final top bit to do...this SLNSW pic appears to have been taken at about this point...ie. August-September-October 1885 Significantly, in the SLNSW pic we don't see the David Jones building at the corner of George and Barrack Streets...the building we see in the SLNSW pic is quite different...clearly, David Jones' 'splendid new premises' can't have been a refit of an existing structure...hence it would appear that the building we see in this PHM pic (above) is indeed the new David Jones building which was completed in ca. March 1887...so this PHM pic would have been taken after this date...which we already knew via what can be gleaned of George Webster & Co's movements...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13606791 - This sad SMH report on the death of a construction worker at the GPO tower in December 1885 is interesting...it appears to indicate that the scaffolding was being removed from the GPO tower as early as December 1885.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: UPDATE ON THE CLOCK FACES AND BELLS...Per this 1891 SMH item (column 2) the GPO clock faces appear to have been fitted in July-August 1891 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-page1377763 ; this article from the Sydney Mail 18/7/1891 shows the bells being hoisted up to the tower (illustrations p. 135 ; article pp. 138-139) - news.google.com/newspapers?id=Mc0QAAAAIBAJ&sjid=TpMDA...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This August 1891 SMH article on the clock makes fascinating reading...at the time the clock faces had been installed and the clock mechanism was almost up and running - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13835041
